alert.note: Alert for Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 7:48PM EST until December 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Spartanburg County in Upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 745 PM EST, Automated rain gauges indicated elevated stream levels across most of central and northern Spartanburg County due to runoff from earlier heavy rainfall. Rainfall totals of 3 to 5 inches were observed in this area over the past 24 hours and additional light showers are possible through late evening. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience minor flooding include... Spartanburg, Greer, Boiling Springs SC, Duncan, Lyman, Pacolet, Landrum, Cowpens, Wellford, Inman, Mayo, Roebuck, Chesnee, Pacolet Mills, Campobello, Reidville, USC Upstate, Moore, Cedar Springs and the Lake Bowen vicinity. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
